item.text: The Lord’s message came to Jonah a second time,

“<st data-num="01980" class="">Go</st> <st data-num="06965" class="">immediately</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="05210" class="">Nineveh</st>, that <st data-num="01419" class="">large</st> <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st>,<n id="2" /> and <st data-num="07121" class="">proclaim</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st><n id="3" /> it the <st data-num="07150" class="">message</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> <st data-num="0595" class="">I</st> <st data-num="01696 0413">tell</st> you.”
So Jonah went immediately to Nineveh, in keeping with the Lord’s message. Now Nineveh was an enormous city—it required three days to walk through it!
Jonah began to enter the city by going one day’s walk, announcing, “At the end of 40 days, Nineveh will be overthrown!”
The people of Nineveh believed in God, and they declared a fast and put on sackcloth, from the greatest to the least of them.

When the <st data-num="01697" class="">news</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="05060 0413">reached</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="05210" class="">Nineveh</st>, he <st data-num="06965" class="">got up</st> from his <st data-num="03678" class="">throne</st>, <st data-num="05674 05921">took off</st> his <st data-num="0155" class="">royal robe</st>, <st data-num="03680" class="">put on</st> <st data-num="08242" class="">sackcloth</st>, and <st data-num="03427" class="">sat</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> <st data-num="0665" class="">ashes</st>.

He <st data-num="02199" class="">issued a proclamation</st> and <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>,<n id="1" /> “In <st data-num="05210" class="">Nineveh</st>, by the <st data-num="02940" class="">decree</st> of the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> and his <st data-num="01419" class="">nobles</st>: <st data-num="0408" class="">No</st> <st data-num="0120" class="">human</st> or <st data-num="0929" class="">animal</st>, <st data-num="01241" class="">cattle</st> or <st data-num="06629" class="">sheep</st>, is to <st data-num="02938" class="">taste</st> <st data-num="03972" class="">anything</st>; they must <st data-num="0408" class="">not</st> <st data-num="07462" class="">eat</st> and they must <st data-num="0408" class="">not</st> <st data-num="08354" class="">drink</st> <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st>.

Every <st data-num="0120" class="">person</st> and <st data-num="0929" class="">animal</st> must <st data-num="03680" class="">put on</st> <st data-num="08242" class="">sackcloth</st> and must <st data-num="07121" class="">cry</st> <st data-num="02394" class="">earnestly</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st>, and <st data-num="0376" class="">everyone</st><n id="2" /> must <st data-num="07725" class="">turn</st> from their<n id="3" /> <st data-num="07451" class="">evil</st> <st data-num="01870" class="">way of living</st><n id="4" /> and <st data-num="04480" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="02555" class="">violence</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> they <st data-num="03709" class="">do</st>.<n id="5" />

<st data-num="04310" class="">Who</st> <st data-num="03045" class="">knows</st>?<n id="1" /> Perhaps <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> might be willing to <st data-num="07725" class="">change</st> his <st data-num="07725" class="">mind</st> and <st data-num="05162" class="">relent</st><n id="2" /> and <st data-num="07725" class="">turn</st> from his <st data-num="02740" class="">fierce</st> <st data-num="0639" class="">anger</st><n id="3" /> so that we might <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="06" class="">die</st>.”<n id="4" />
When God saw their actions—that they turned from their evil way of living—God relented concerning the judgment he had threatened them with and did not destroy them.
